programme.title: The National Dog Show ('20)
programme.desc: From the Kennel Club of Philadelphia, this cherished competition for all dog lovers returns for the 17th year. Hosted by John O'Hurley, the event features 2,000 of the nation's leading canines, including the world’s largest, smallest and most exotic. Over 170 breeds strut their stuff with the hope of becoming this year's top dog. “The Dean” David Frei provides expert show commentary, and Mary Carillo chimes in as an adept sideline reporter for this ultimate canine showdown. But which dog will have their day, and which will leave with their tail between their legs? After all, there can only be one “Best in Show”.

programme.desc: Jess is looking after Horace's underwater friends in the pond whilst Horace is away. He sees a funny creature with a round head, a long tail and a little mark on his nose. “What's the funny little creature in the pond?” Hey! That's the Big Question! The creature has vanished so Jess describes it to Mimi who draws a picture of it. Mimi, Joey and Jinx think it must be a fish and name him Freddie, but Jess is not so sure. Time passes and Jess doesn't see Freddie again for ages. When he does spot him he's grown two back legs! Jess decides he needs a closer look using Billie's magnifying glass. They search for Freddie all round the pond. Baa thinks he's found him, but it turns out to be a newt, with four legs and spots on its back. At that moment a small frog jumps out onto a lily pad. It has the white mark on its nose just like Freddie but this is a frog! What's happened wonders Jess. Horace comes back and explains that frogs start out as tadpoles and gradually change, growing legs and losing their tail.

programme.title: Guess with Jess
programme.desc: Horace has planned a big musical show but before it can start it begins raining and everyone runs for shelter. How can we keep dry? Asks JESS - that's the Big Question. Jess thinks that maybe they could wear a hat to keep dry – Baa's hat is soft and lets the water in though so that's no good but it gives Jess another idea. They can use the big basket in his barn as a giant hat to keep them all dry. It's made of wood and is hard. It's bound to keep them dry. But the woven basket lets the water in too. What are they going to do? Mimi walks by with her umbrella. She's lovely and dry. They all try to crowd under it but it's not big enough. We need to build a BIG umbrella says Jess. programme.title: Guess with Jess
programme.desc: Jess and his friends are playing a game trying to use wind power to push the trolley through the hay bale arch. None of them can blow hard enough so it always slows down before it gets to the arch. Jess asks the Big Question - how can I make the trolley go faster. They try different ideas - blowing, making a bigger wind by blowing as a group, making an even bigger wind by flapping potato sacks but nothing is strong enough. Jess is asking Mimi for some help when a big gust of wind catches her potato sack blanket, making it billow out just like a ship's sail, which gives Jess a great idea! Maybe if he ties the sacks to the trolley, like a sail, the trolley will move in the wind. Success! Jess has answered another Big Question - he can move the trolley through the hay bale arch by tying a sail to it! And now they can all have fun riding in the trolley too! Yippety yay!

He's trying to make a lovely new musical sound but the square shaped piece of bark he's got doesn't make a very good noise when he clangs it with a stick. programme.title: Wild Heroes

programme.desc: Explore the impact three American women had on British fashion, interior design, and even Parliament. Nancy Astor, Nancy Lancaster, and Pauline de Rothschild made the voyage for different reasons, but each shared the desire to stand up and be heard.

programme.title: Wild Heroes
programme.desc: Oscar-winner Kate Winslet, known for Titanic, is celebrated for her versatile, intense performances in both Hollywood blockbusters and indie films, cementing her as one of the finest actors of her generation.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: After injecting all the teachers with bee DNA, the Melvins run the new "hivemind" of the school. But Ms. Ribble is accidently injected with too much "Bee- NA" and becomes the queen bee, overpowering the Melvins' control. George, Harold and the recently re-hired Vice Principal Krupp must work with the Melvins and stop her from turning everyone into her Zombees.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: In hopes of raising their grades so they can go to Lake Summer Camp, George and Harold must teach Ratrick, their assigned rat, a simple task. But Ratrick runs away into the sewers where he is doused with toxic waste and transformed into Poopacabra! It's now up to the boys and Captain Underpants to stop the beast before it takes over Piqua with its stench, and more importantly, ruins the boys' chances to go to Lake Summer Camp.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: George and Harold decide to do an extra credit project on dinosaurs to help their chances of getting summer camp-worthy grades. When Melvin brings in a dinosaur frozen in ice, the boys try to get rid of it. But the ice thaws and they meet Diddlysaurus, a prankster raptor who's huge fans of the boys. He offers to help them with their project if he can pull pranks with them, but when the pranks go too far, the boys and Captain Underpants have to deal with the dino.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Dragon Knight
programme.desc: There is more epic action and intrigue as Po and the Dragon Knights continue their quest to destroy the Tianshang weapons, but find themselves in treacherous waters when they are captured by pirates, one of which is out for revenge against Mr. Ping! The adventures lead them to London, where they are wanted by the Knights. Old enemies resurface and Blade will have to face one of her most challenging opponents—her mom. And somehow, Po finds himself in a chess tournament against the Queen of England!

programme.title: Guess with Jess
programme.desc: Jess is looking after Horace's underwater friends in the pond whilst Horace is away. He sees a funny creature with a round head, a long tail and a little mark on his nose. “What's the funny little creature in the pond?” Hey! That's the Big Question! The creature has vanished so Jess describes it to Mimi who draws a picture of it. Mimi, Joey and Jinx think it must be a fish and name him Freddie, but Jess is not so sure. Time passes and Jess doesn't see Freddie again for ages. When he does spot him he's grown two back legs! Jess decides he needs a closer look using Billie's magnifying glass. They search for Freddie all round the pond. Baa thinks he's found him, but it turns out to be a newt, with four legs and spots on its back. At that moment a small frog jumps out onto a lily pad. It has the white mark on its nose just like Freddie but this is a frog! What's happened wonders Jess. Horace comes back and explains that frogs start out as tadpoles and gradually change, growing legs and losing their tail.

programme.title: Guess with Jess
programme.desc: Horace has planned a big musical show but before it can start it begins raining and everyone runs for shelter. How can we keep dry? Asks JESS - that's the Big Question. Jess, Baa and Billie find shelter under some vine leaves. They're keeping dry but they're too far away from the pond to watch the show. Jess thinks that maybe they could wear a hat to keep dry – Baa's hat is soft and lets the water in though so that's no good but it gives Jess another idea. They can use the big basket in his barn as a giant hat to keep them all dry. It's made of wood and is hard. It's bound to keep them dry. But the woven basket lets the water in too. What are they going to do? Mimi walks by with her umbrella. She's lovely and dry. They all try to crowd under it but it's not big enough. We need to build a BIG umbrella says Jess. programme.title: Guess with Jess

They decide to clean out HORACE'S pond for him and take all the yukky pond weed to the river where the hungry fishes gobble it up. But when they get back they find that KEVIN is unhappy in his pond. “How can I cheer up Kevin?” That's the Big Question. First JESS thinks that KEVIN might be lonely so they take it in turns to keep him company. But KEVIN seems even more unhappy than before. Jess thinks that KEVIN is probably hungry. They saw the fish in the river eating weed so they go back to the river to get some for KEVIN. KEVIN gobbles up the weed, but he's soon looking sad again. JESS thinks that maybe staying in one place all the time is making KEVIN unhappy. So he gives him a little holiday in the river. KEVIN really perks up. A holiday seems to be the answer. programme.title: Guess with Jess
programme.desc: It's Christmas Eve on Greendale Farm. Jess is very very excited. Every year Mimi decorates the special tree in the woods and the friends all gather around to sing and play and open presents. But when Jess, Mimi and Willow arrive to leave presents at the tree they're shocked to see that the wind has blown all the decorations away! How dreadful! - How will they celebrate Christmas with no decorations? And Mimi can't help as she and Willow have promised to deliver presents outside the farm. Jess promises to work it out ‘How can we decorate the Christmas Tree?' – that's the Big Question!. He searches the farm for decorations but cannot find them. Then he realises he's found some lovely natural things that they can use to MAKE decorations. Yippety Yay! Of course! So everyone pulls together and gathers fircones and teasels, straw and bulrushes. programme.title: Guess with Jess
programme.desc: Jess and his friends are playing a game trying to use wind power to push the trolley through the hay bale arch. None of them can blow hard enough so it always slows down before it gets to the arch. Jess asks the Big Question - how can I make the trolley go faster. They try different ideas - blowing, making a bigger wind by blowing as a group, making an even bigger wind by flapping potato sacks but nothing is strong enough. Jess is asking Mimi for some help when a big gust of wind catches her potato sack blanket, making it billow out just like a ship's sail, which gives Jess a great idea! Maybe if he ties the sacks to the trolley, like a sail, the trolley will move in the wind. Success! Jess has answered another Big Question - he can move the trolley through the hay bale arch by tying a sail to it! And now they can all have fun riding in the trolley too! Yippety yay!

programme.title: Guess with Jess
programme.desc: There's a hole in the bottom of Baa's trough so none of the thirsty friends can have a drink. How can we mend the trough, wonders Jess. Hey, that's the Big Question. Jess decides to ask Horace for help but Horace has a problem of his own. He's trying to make a lovely new musical sound but the square shaped piece of bark he's got doesn't make a very good noise when he clangs it with a stick. Jess borrows the bark to cover the hole in the trough but it's the wrong shape. He decides to ask Mimi for help with making a different shape to cover the hole. Mimi's making a mosaic, but she can't find anything the right shape to fit the square-shaped hole she has. Jess gives her the bit of bark and it fits perfectly! She sings Jess a shapes song explaining all about different shapes around us. Jess finds a squashed clay pot which is circle shaped. This reality program warmly portrays their concerns about jobs, marriage, and parenting while living in Korea.

programme.title: Two Days and One Night 4
programme.desc: Two-day road trip to the beautiful spots in all the corners of Korea! Instead of fancy studio, this on-the-road reality show takes place in the rural sides. programme.title: I'm Sorry My Love

programme.title: Pasahero

programme.title: The Wife
programme.desc: A couple's marriage gets tainted as the husband cheats. How can the wife take her husband's dying plea to be with her and his mistress at the remaining days of his life?

programme.title: Who's That Girl?
programme.desc: A one-of-a-kind romantic-comedy movie about a girl who is an alleged mistress of a business tycoon, husband to Eugene Domingo's character,and father to Luis Manzano's character.

programme.title: Fangirl Fanboy
programme.desc: It tells the story of a wannabe actor and a talented teleserye dubber who agrees to help him improve his acting. Her coaching helps him achieve his dream of becoming a star only to find herself heartbroken when he becomes successful.

programme.title: Torotot
programme.desc: Torotot explores the story of two couples, why and how their marriages crumble and how their infidelity and passions have brought them tragic endings.

programme.title: The Trigonal
programme.desc: An underground fighting circuit run by an international crime syndicate invades a retired MMA champion's small, idyllic island hometown. Syndicate thugs brutally assault his wife and kill his best friend, leaving him with no other choice but to fight for justice.

programme.title: Babaylan
programme.desc: An immortal woman falls for a dashing young man, without her knowing that his ancestor was her lover in the past. They must work together to escape an insane man who's after her fountain of youth.

programme.title: Sanggano, Sanggago't Sanggwapo
programme.desc: Three troublesome friends learns that one of them is actually rich when his father passes away and leaves him a hacienda.

programme.title: Sunny
programme.desc: A Philippine adaptation of the 2011 hit Korean movie. Sunny is the story of a middle-aged woman who dreams to fulfill her dying wish to reunite with high school friends.

programme.title: Elemento
programme.desc: The story is about Cristine (Kara) and her struggle when her son Lucas (Albert Silos) returned from school field trip, with a different soul.

programme.title: Beauty and the Bestie
programme.desc: For an important case, a policeman needs the help of his former best friend to impersonate the daughter of a foreign dignitary in a beauty pageant.

programme.title: The Christmas Quest
programme.desc: Stefanie teams up with ex-husband Chase to go to Iceland at Christmastime in search of the legendary treasure of the Yule Lads.

programme.title: Roots: The Next Generations E10 - The Great Depression (Part 2)
programme.desc: The dramatization of Alex Haley's family line from post Civil War America to the writer's search for his roots.

programme.title: CSI S5 E16 - Big Middle
programme.desc: Some provocative episodes from Season 5 of CSI involve Russian mail order brides ("Nesting Dolls"), infantism ("King Baby"), and the Mexican lifestyle of narcocorrido ("Snakes"). From the creative storytelling ("4x4") to the macabre ("Who Shot Sherlock?"), there’s something in Season 5 for everyone. The CSI team investigates many crimes that hit close to home as well. Grissom comes under fire from Ecklie ("Mea Culpa"), Brass tracks down his estranged daughter ("Hollywood Brass"), and during the course of the season Greg Sanders completes his transition from the lab to the field. Last, but not least, Season 5 wraps with an amazing two-part episode ("Grave Danger"), written and directed by Quentin Tarantino, where Nick comes face to face with death while the team exhausts all its resources to same him.

programme.desc: Sometimes the strangest things on Earth are happening just below its surface. These are the weird and wondrous tales of the sea beasts, hidden cities, and impossible creatures that lurk beneath us.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner (S3)
programme.desc: For hundreds of years, there have been legends of vast treasures hidden throughout the United States. Stories of stolen gold, piracy, murderous revenge—but are these legends of lost treasures tall tales?

programme.title: The Pickers (S18)
programme.desc: In Ohio, a late friend's picking nirvana has the Wolfe brothers howling. With a successful demolition business and an eye for treasure, Brian amassed a mind-boggling collection of rare, oversize gems.

programme.title: The Mega-Brands That Built The World (S3)
programme.desc: Three American retail icons are born within months of each other in 1962, sparking a rivalry for the ages as each fights to revolutionise shopping through innovation, low prices, and unique strategies.

programme.title: The Mega-Brands That Built The World (S3)
programme.desc: American cars get a makeover when an engineer creates the first sports car. And Detroit's Big 3 begin transforming their functional, practical cars into American sports cars.

programme.desc: In the midst of the 1970s folk art movement, art student Martha Nelson creates a one-of-a-kind doll to sell at local Kentucky craft markets.

programme.desc: In the aftermath of a freak storm, the remaining survivalists take stock of their place in the game. One participant takes a risk on an ambitious shelter.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH 5min.
programme.desc: Curry rice, one of Japan's most iconic national dishes. How did Jimbocho, Tokyo become a curry town?

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Mt. Fuji, the tallest mountain in Japan, has many faces. See the beauty of these different Fujis through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: GRAND SUMO Highlights
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from January 11, Day 1 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Tokyo.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: My Street Piano
programme.desc: Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture, is a known castle town. In one commercial area sits a piano, which passersby love to visit and play from the heart.

programme.title: BIZ STREAM
programme.desc: The Ultimate in Urban Mining: This episode features companies that have come up with innovative ways of extracting strategic minerals such as gold, cobalt, and platinum from urban waste.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.desc: Shirakawa-go is one of Japan's snowiest regions, famous for its traditional thatched-roof Gassho-style homes. Every detail of life here is reflected in the cooperative bond shared by residents.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet Ashraf Baburi in Chiba Prefecture who provides work to women in his native Afghanistan by importing traditional rugs they weave, and French-born Stephane Danton who runs a tea store in Tokyo.

programme.title: HAGI: With the Flow
programme.desc: Locals in Hagi, on a delta facing the Sea of Japan, have lived in harmony with its waters. Beautiful time-lapse footage captures people crossing rivers by boat and canals flowing into homes.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
programme.desc: In this episode, we learn about the winter dates of Shokan and Daikan. The nuns teach us how to make seasonal rice porridge with seven herbs, kan-koji fermented rice and dried vegetables.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: In 2024, Miyakoshi Akiko won a New York Times' Best Illustrated Children's Book Award. We see how she creates art, using charcoal and watercolors. And we discover the inspiration behind her work.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH 5min.
programme.desc: Curry rice, one of Japan's most iconic national dishes. How did Jimbocho, Tokyo become a curry town?

programme.title: Framing Everyday Moments
programme.desc: A unique time-lapse photography project. Shot by pros and non-pros from around the world, on the transience of nature, celestial phenomena, cityscapes and each single moment of everyday life.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Riverside Sawmill
programme.desc: Workers at a sawmill use the latest tools and their honed skills to prepare the building blocks of Edo life: long, narrow beams, bamboo stems and leftover wood stacked as high as buildings.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony #2 Summer
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to kaku, or "to write." Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: Samurai Sword Enthusiasts
programme.desc: The fact that foreign collectors cherish Japanese swords helps to unearth ancient works taken overseas after 1945. It also serves as a force for preserving traditional techniques facing extinction.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Gojinjo Taiko is a wild, powerful performance by masked drummers. It originated 400 years ago, when villagers disguised themselves as oni (demons) to scare away a warlord's army.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: My Street Piano
programme.desc: Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture, is a known castle town. In one commercial area sits a piano, which passersby love to visit and play from the heart.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: Two drugs have been approved for their potential to slow the progression of Alzheimer's disease. We look at how they work and report on new findings suggesting a food-derived component may also help.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.desc: Shirakawa-go is one of Japan's snowiest regions, famous for its traditional thatched-roof Gassho-style homes. Every detail of life here is reflected in the cooperative bond shared by residents.

programme.title: Preparation
programme.desc: Luna, a girl who is uncomfortable with doctor's office, comes to understand the value of medicine via the thrilling explanations of a mysterious doctor. This episode is about doctor's office.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet Ashraf Baburi in Chiba Prefecture who provides work to women in his native Afghanistan by importing traditional rugs they weave, and French-born Stephane Danton who runs a tea store in Tokyo.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE

programme.title: CINEMATIC JOURNEY
programme.desc: Kyle Card hikes along the 1000km trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japan where he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

programme.title: YONEZAWA: "Beni," Japanese Red
programme.desc: Since ancient times, safflowers grown in Yonezawa have been used to dye fabric a deep red color associated with the sun. Experience its mysterious, vivid beauty through time-lapse footage.

programme.title: GRAND SUMO Highlights
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from January 12, Day 2 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Tokyo.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: 1/2: People Who Don't Drink
programme.desc: 1 in 2 don't drink in Japan, where intense social drinking is normal. Through interviews of drinkers and non-drinkers we hear both sides, including a couple who went sober and opened a no-alcohol bar.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #8 This is my friend, Ayaka-san. / To introduce someone to someone else, say a word to explain the relationship, followed by "no" and then the person's name and "desu".

programme.title: Samurai Sword Enthusiasts
programme.desc: The fact that foreign collectors cherish Japanese swords helps to unearth ancient works taken overseas after 1945. It also serves as a force for preserving traditional techniques facing extinction.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: We introduce a lineup of programs conveying Japan's unique perspectives and cultural practices. Themes include falconry, etiquette, and the National Museum of Japanese History.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Gojinjo Taiko is a wild, powerful performance by masked drummers. It originated 400 years ago, when villagers disguised themselves as oni (demons) to scare away a warlord's army.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH 5min.
programme.desc: Curry rice, one of Japan's most iconic national dishes. How did Jimbocho, Tokyo become a curry town?

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Tsutaju
programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode takes a close look at artist Utamaro's iconic "Woman with a Glass Noisemaker."

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: In 2024, Miyakoshi Akiko won a New York Times' Best Illustrated Children's Book Award. We see how she creates art, using charcoal and watercolors. And we discover the inspiration behind her work.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH 5min.
programme.desc: Curry rice, one of Japan's most iconic national dishes. How did Jimbocho, Tokyo become a curry town?

programme.title: Framing Everyday Moments
programme.desc: A unique time-lapse photography project. Shot by pros and non-pros from around the world, on the transience of nature, celestial phenomena, cityscapes and each single moment of everyday life.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Riverside Sawmill
programme.desc: Workers at a sawmill use the latest tools and their honed skills to prepare the building blocks of Edo life: long, narrow beams, bamboo stems and leftover wood stacked as high as buildings.

programme.title: Realities of Disaster Non-Profits
programme.desc: One year after the 2024 Noto Peninsula Earthquake but recovery is slow. Non-profit organizations have been indispensable in supporting the victims and helping them to rebuild their lives.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: Two drugs have been approved for their potential to slow the progression of Alzheimer's disease. We look at how they work and report on new findings suggesting a food-derived component may also help.

programme.title: Where We Call Home

programme.title: Tales of the Undeparted
programme.desc: Eight members of the Japanese idol group AKB48 gather at a temple to talk about their most mysterious and terrifying stories. As the group sits in a circle, each member shares a ghost story, urban legend, or paranormal activity found in Japanese folklore. They each holds a lit lantern, and as each story concludes, a lantern extinguishes…

programme.title: Watch Me Kill
programme.desc: A ruthless assassin named Luciana is hired by a kingpin to murder a man with a valuable diamond. Complications ensue when Luciana stumbles upon a teenage girl who is held captive by the man, and the kingpin discovers that the diamond Luciana turned over is fake.

programme.title: Sinister
programme.desc: Si Nan and her husband travel to Kuala Lumpur for a vacation to relieve her pregnancy stress. However, she soon uncovers his evil plan to turn their child into a 'Luk Krok' for profit, which puts her in grave danger. With the help of the hotel ghosts, she manages to flee and alert the police to arrest him, finally giving birth to her child.

programme.title: Detective Dee's Seven Deadly Sin
programme.desc: Detective Dee becomes embroiled in a series of murders that shake the Tang Empire. The killer invokes the "Seven Deadly Sins" to justify a twisted sense of justice. In his relentless pursuit of the truth, Detective Dee uncovers the mask of false righteousness and exposes the darkness hidden beneath.

programme.title: Paper Man
programme.desc: As the police investigate a gang murder case, another mysterious paper man murder happens, and the suspects get killed one by one. Continuing to track the clues of the case, the police finally unveil a hidden secret and tragedy over two generations.

programme.title: Sa Haba Ng Gabi
programme.desc: Two housemaids and a driver take shelter at their employer's mansion when a zombie outbreak happens one night. Can they all survive the night?

programme.title: They Wait in the Dark
programme.desc: Amy and her adopted son Adrian flee from her abusive ex-girlfriend Judith. Seeking refuge in an abandoned farmhouse in Amy's Kansas hometown, they confront a supernatural evil force from her dark past that haunts Adrian. As Judith pursues them, Amy and Adrian must face the dangers both outside and within the house.

programme.title: 3AM
programme.desc: A woman in hospital accidentally discovers her husband’s affair. On the verge of breakdown, she begins to encounter a “stranger” who claims to also be a victim of the affair. Is this entity a figment of her imagination or a vengeful spirit? As she struggles to control her thoughts and actions, can she stop herself from hurting those around her?

programme.title: 3AM
programme.desc: A school girl joins two internet content creators in a horror video project filmed in an old building behind their school. The trio encounters a bullying gang and as events unfold, it becomes clear that the girl holds a personal grudge against the gang and is blinded by hatred to exercise justice, even if it means sacrificing the innocents…

programme.title: Homicide Squad New Orleans (S1)
programme.desc: With the help of his partner Det. Hill, Det. Stewart tracks down the killers of a good Samaritan who was attempting to stop a crime in progress.

programme.title: Cold Case Files (S3)
programme.desc: When a beloved schoolteacher is found murdered in her Neptune, New Jersey apartment in the fall of 2009, suspicion is cast on her soon to be ex-husband.

programme.title: The First 48 (S25)
programme.desc: A visit to Mobile ends in tragedy when a violent chain reaction leads to the death of a teenage girl.

programme.title: Murder At The Motel
programme.desc: On July 9th, 2018, officers from the Beckley Police Department received a distressing call from a woman claiming that she and her friends had been kidnapped and terrorised at the Travelodge on Harper Road.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder (S1)
programme.desc: Savannah and Trent Paschal seem like the perfect suburban couple — madly in love. But when Savannah finds her calling as a funeral director, their romance ends in suspicion, and a countrywide police hunt.

programme.title: Murder In The 21st
programme.desc: A young, pregnant woman is found dead of an apparent suicide in Saginaw, MI, but her family and friends don't believe it. The police discover a shocking secret they never saw coming.

programme.title: Jean Perera: The Beauty Queen Murder
programme.desc: When former Malaysian beauty queen Jean Perera was found brutally stabbed in 1979, the subsequent murder trial would capture and divide public opinion.

programme.title: Taking The Stand (S1)
programme.desc: When an off-duty Dallas police officer shoots a man in his own apartment, the jury will have to decide if it was murder or a tragic mistake. Amber Guyger takes the stand in her own defense.

programme.title: Taking The Stand (S1)
programme.desc: When railroad mechanic Robert Limon is shot and killed by Jonathan Hearn, an investigation leads to Robert's widow — and spurs questions about her involvement in the crime.

programme.title: #TextMeWhenYouGetHome (S2)
programme.desc: When beautiful Jalajhia Finklea vanished the day before her 18th birthday, her Wampanoag Tribe members immediately took action.

programme.title: Taking The Stand (S3)
programme.desc: In 2019, Delinord Dumercy takes the stand for the second time, claiming that his decision to shoot and ultimately kill James Peoples was in self-defence and not murder.

programme.title: Gigantosaurus
programme.desc: Four little dinosaurs, Rocky, Bill, Tiny and Mazu, discover a dangerous world where the mysterious Gigantosaurus, the most ferocious of all the dinosaurs, is forever on the prowl. The four best friends set their heading for adventure, confronting their fears and working together to solve all their problems.

programme.title: Foot Go
programme.desc: Eight year-old Tata arrives in a new school. She wants to join its football team but isn't allowed to; after all she's a girl! Refusing to be beaten, Tata decides to set up her own girls' team with the help of her gang of friends.

programme.title: Les Quiquoi
programme.desc: Olive, Pétole, Boulard, Mixo, Raoul and Pamela make up a full-of-fun gang known as the Quiquoi. Together they ask a host of existential questions, using drawings to find the answers. In their own quirky way, they love nothing better than creating surrealist worlds where everything becomes possible.

programme.title: Raconte À Wanda Jemly
programme.desc: Children tell a story, a traditional tale or an anecdote to the Cameroonian author and storyteller Wanda Jemly. Smiles and emotion guaranteed!

programme.title: Raconte À Wanda Jemly
programme.desc: Children tell a story, a traditional tale or an anecdote to the Cameroonian author and storyteller Wanda Jemly. Smiles and emotion guaranteed!

programme.title: Tout Le Monde Veut Prendre Sa Place
programme.desc: The game where everyone wants to be a winner. One quiz, six candidates and, comfortably installed in his chair, one champion... whom everyone dreams of unseating!

programme.title: Itinéraires Paysans
programme.desc: The different attitudes and approaches of French farmers in terms of the environment, economy and landscape. A practical way of understanding a region and its terroir through their working practices.

programme.title: Un Si Grand Soleil
programme.desc: The Bastide, Estrela, Salama, Lévy, Berville and Alami families, plus a host of supporting characters, live and work in the modern everyday city of Montpellier, in southern France. Between romance and crime thriller, with a blend of comic and serious themes, their stories weave a fascinating web.

programme.title: Au Bout De L'Enquête, La Fin Du Crime Parfait ?
programme.desc: Antoinette, Marcelle, Raymonde, Augustine... They were all aged over 70 and were all killed in the space of several months at home at the beginning of the 1990s. Only clue: the murders took place along the 192 bus route south of Paris...

programme.title: Le Journal De France 2
programme.desc: The television news programme of the France 2 editorial board (1 p.m. edition, Paris time).

programme.title: Flash(S) - Double Vue
programme.desc: Audrey Beau-Manoir has been charged with her husband's murder. Amnesic after the shock, she did not deny it. Today, her memory is coming back. Claire, who has had visions about the case, urges her daughter Mathilde to reopen the investigation.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: The Albert-Kahn museum unveils the banker's humanist project. Sometimes called ''the time folder'', Simone Pheulpin works with cotton ribbon. For his first show at Dries Van Noten, Julian Klausner plays with textures and colours. Sophie Brillouet's studio is alive with beach air.

programme.title: Fifi
programme.desc: 15 year-old Sophie, known as Fifi, has to spend the summer with parents, brothers and sisters, in a cramped flat on a rowdy Nancy council estate. With her friend Jade away on holiday she pinches her keys and takes refuge in her flat. But Stéphane, Jade's older brother, arrives unexpectedly...

programme.title: Fraîche
programme.desc: At the age of 58 and at the head of a literary programme on the radio, Anne leads a settled and peaceful family life. Until the day she attacks a young woman with incredible violence simply because she offers Anne her seat on the metro.

programme.title: À Propos D'Antoine
programme.desc: Julie arrives at Marc's, the new love of her life, to meet his family. The young woman has just ended an easy-going relationship to find herself thrown into a joyous chaos centred on Antoine, a child with multiple disabilities.

programme.title: À Propos D'Antoine
programme.desc: Despite her feelings of insecurity, Julie has to borrow the bike belonging to Marc's ex-wife. The latter's home is filled with family photos and memorabilia making Julie wonder if everything is really sorted between the former couple.

programme.title: À Propos D'Antoine
programme.desc: Julie is filled with doubts: what exactly happened between Marc and Justine; why did they split up? But when she tries to discover the truth behind their secret, Marc pushes her to join an experimental theatre company.

programme.title: À Propos D'Antoine
programme.desc: Just as Julie is about to head to Montreal for an audition that could launch her career, Antoine suffers an epileptic fit. The seizure obviously upsets her plans for the day and leaves her facing a dilemma.

programme.title: Maghreb-Orient Express
programme.desc: What's new in the Arab worlds? Journalist Mohamed Kaci hosts those making the cultural headlines in Tunis, Algiers, Rabat, Beirut, Alexandria, Dubai...

programme.title: 64' Actu
programme.desc: TV5MONDE's major daily news programme, decrypting the news! What you need to know: the Francophone view of the day's main events. Economics, social debates, international news: the expertise of our journalists. New weekend features: the French-speaking world, social networks, fake news, politics, sport...

programme.title: 64' Débat
programme.desc: TV5MONDE's major daily news programme, decrypting the news! What it's all about: the guests take an in-depth look at a key issue. Increased focus on Francophone cultural news, with dedicated sequences. New weekend features: the French-speaking world, social networks, fake news, politics, sport...

programme.title: L'Invité
programme.desc: Patrick Simonin hosts the stars in the headlines, culture, music, film, books, an unmissable rendezvous with all those who light up our times.

programme.title: Au Bout De L'Enquête, La Fin Du Crime Parfait ?
programme.desc: Antoinette, Marcelle, Raymonde, Augustine... They were all aged over 70 and were all killed in the space of several months at home at the beginning of the 1990s. Only clue: the murders took place along the 192 bus route south of Paris...

programme.title: Le Journal De La Rtbf
programme.desc: Complete international news roundup presented by the RTBF news staff.

programme.title: Tendance Xxi
programme.desc: LVMH drops its bags in the Salle Pleyel, presenting all its skills and craftsmanship. All about white chocolate. An American school in the Lubéron: SCAD Lacoste trains the artists of tomorrow, guided by fashion designer Julien Fournier. Sparkle and glitter is back in fashion: how to wear sequins.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: Hélène Cochet, biologist specialising in mariculture, has been studying the European flat oyster for twenty years, the combat of her life. The only oyster native to France, yet virtually unknown to the general public. In a generation it has become forgotten, gradually replaced by the Pacific oyster from Asia. Report by: Nicolas Brikké, Chloë Ledoux.

programme.title: Le Journal Afrique
programme.desc: All the African news from the TV5MONDE news staff.

programme.title: L'Actu
programme.desc: The televised news programme from TVMonaco.

programme.title: Le Journal De La Rts
programme.desc: All the news from RTS.

programme.desc: The television news programme of the France 2 editorial board (8 p.m. edition, Paris time).

programme.title: C Dans L'Air
programme.desc: All the latest major events, presented, explained and analysed! Special guests and journalists in the studio analyse both the latest news but also other controversial issues to give us a better understanding of the social, political and cultural events occurring around us.

programme.title: Chroniques D'En Haut
programme.desc: In the Swiss Alps, the Val d'Hérens is composed of three valleys. They form a unique ensemble, a community of stories and destinies whose trace is visible in the landscape.

programme.title: Un Si Grand Soleil

Between romance and crime thriller, with a blend of comic and serious themes, their stories weave a fascinating web.

programme.title: Ding Dong : Montre-Moi Ta Maison !
programme.desc: The tour begins with a visit to a renovated farmhouse before moving on to a prefabricated house.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
